title: This "Aren't you to old to be playing video games?" mentality
body: I don't understand why so many people have this mentality. So many times I hear these 12 year olds saying stuff like "Aren't you like 20? Go get a job and life" or something along those lines. Do they not understand that the people making the games they are playing are between the ages of 20-50 and I'm sure there are some over 50. If people get to old to play games then you must think they can get to old to make them. You are never to old to play game or watch cartoons. If you are 30 and like watching Spongebob and playing WoW then enjoy them and have no shame.

Here's a funny thing that happened a couple of Saturdays ago. 
____
A, presumably, 50+ year old English Tutor is looking desperate in finding something to talk about the Viewing Section of the English Exam.
He scrolls through rolls of images on his computer screen looking for topics to fill the empty silence of the classroom of late 16 to early 18 year olds. 
He then stops at what looks like it didn't sell well with its poorly illustrated video game poster which is titled The [Jade Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jade_Empire).

The enthusiastic aged old man explains the question - which revolved around how a target audience's ideologies are reflected in the text.

"Who's the target audience? Anyone?"
Eyes scan each other's faces around the room of students looking too tired to listen to some old fart at such a pleasant Saturday morning.

The tutor breaks the silence - "*Gamers!* That's the audience! Now, some of you might be gamers and some might not be; I personally know people who play video games from a young age and get *hooked* on it, some I know are 30 years into it now."
I respond with a nod of acknowledgement and interest. 

I assume others were smirking because he then goes on, "Nothin' to laugh about! Some guys get hooked on video games for life and can't stop! They do nothing else with their lives."

"Did you know that 80% of high school achievers - those that receive school awards - are females? Young boys are now lost in their *video games* staring at their screens grunting, "Ooh! I've got to get those 5000 points!"" The old man's acting transforming him into some overweight, greasy and unhygienic man child. 

My friend, who regularly plays League of Legends, soundlessly gasps besides me during the short pause of silence in the room.

"Now, I don't know about you but we can assume gamers have no ideology when it comes to the world. They're too busy mashing their controllers to think of anything important."

Scribbling the word, '*ageism*' on my noteless notebook, I nudged my friend's elbow to catch his attention to it. 
He shakes his head in agreement.
